lead_paragraph: Many people close to Mrs. Clinton, including her husband, believed the state would serve as a lifeline, but instead, Senator Bernie Sanders won.

byline.contributor: Jason Horowitz contributed reporting from Manchester, N.H.

headline.print_headline: After Primary Rout, Sanders Broadens Effort as Clinton Looks to Retool Message
headline.main: After New Hampshire, Hillary Clinton Struggles to Find Her Footing

snippet: Many people close to Mrs. Clinton, including her husband, believed the state would serve as a lifeline, but instead, Senator Bernie Sanders won.
abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders's rout of Hillary Rodham Clinton in New Hampshire has sent her scrambling to retool message she has carefully crafted in state since 2008; Sanders's victory results in windfall of Internet donations, allowing him to expand campaign ahead of scheduled primaries.
